name: Purple Cloak Alocasia
description: Alocasia princeps 'Purple Cloak', commonly known as Purple Cloak Alocasia, is a tropical aroid native to Borneo, Malaysia. It belongs to the Araceae family (aroid family) and features large, arrow-shaped to shield-shaped, dark purple to almost black leaves (40-80 cm long) with prominent purple veins. The leaves have a velvety texture and are held on long, purple petioles. The plant displays an upright, clumping growth habit and typically reaches 90-150 cm in height. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers typical of aroids (spathe and spadix). In its native habitat, it grows as a terrestrial plant in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant creates a bold, dramatic statement with its large, dark purple leaves. It's extremely popular among aroid enthusiasts for its striking dark coloration.
